TimeSlot.name: TimeSlot
TimeSlot.description: Represents a period of time on a specified day of the week during which work can be performed in Salesforce Scheduler. Operating hours consist of one or more time slots.

DayOfWeek.description: The day of the week when the time slot takes place.

EndTime.description: The time when the time slot ends.

LastReferencedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed a record related to this record.

LastViewedDate.description: The timestamp for when the current user last viewed this record. If this value is null, this record can only have been referenced (LastReferencedDate) and not viewed.

MaxAppointments.description: Maximum number of appointments for a single time slot. Available in API version 47.0 and later.

OperatingHoursId.description: The operating hours that the time slot belongs to. An operating hours’ time slots appear in the Operating Hours related list.

StartTime.description: The time when the time slot starts.

TimeSlotNumber.description: The name of the time slot. The name is auto-populated to a day and time format—for example, Monday 9:00 AM - 10:00 PM—but you can manually update it.

Type.description: The type of time slot. Possible values are Normal and Extended. Default value must be Normal. You can choose to use Extended to represent overtime shifts.

WorkTypeGroupId.description: Work type group assigned to the time slot. Available in API version 47.0 and later.
